key_risks: Exposure to catastrophic events and natural disasters
Economic sensitivity to downturns, inflation, and interest rate changes
Regulatory risks from changes in insurance laws and legal uncertainties
Integration risks related to Markel Ventures' acquisitions
Fraud and legal challenges, including coverage disputes and discriminatory practices
Activist investor pressure from Jana Partners
controversies: Defamation lawsuits related to insured clients
environmental_issues: Vulnerability to climate change and increasing frequency of extreme weather events
social_issues: Allegations of discriminatory practices by insured clients
Insurance fraud and related legal penalties
governance_issues: Activist investor pressure to separate or sell Markel Ventures
Regulatory scrutiny and legal uncertainties impacting operations

sources.title: Changes to the CQC regulatory framework: are prosecutions on the rise?
sources.snippet: The Care Quality Commission (CQC) announced wholesale changes to its regulatory framework in 2022. The rollout of the pilot scheme commenced in August 2022, with a view to a full rollout in 2023. The rollout has been subject to various delays, however, and the CQC has stated that it is now expected to begin the rollout of its new assessment approach "later in 2023".
